definition: to pale by comparison (idiom)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
to appear/to look/form/shape
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
crimson silk/deficiency/to stitch

sentences.english: The young girl violinist outshone all the other competitors.
sentences.chinese: 小提琴使所有的竞争者相形见绌。
本使他的同事们都相形见绌。

sentences.english: She dwarfed all her rivals in athletic ability.
sentences.chinese: 她在体育运动方面的才能使她的对手相形见绌。

sentences.english: U8 :It goes without saying that Shakespeare overshadows all the other playwrights through the ages.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问，莎士比亚使各个时代的剧作家相形见绌。

sentences.english: We are overshadowed by a nimbus of ideas.
sentences.chinese: 想法周围的光环让我们相形见绌。

sentences.english: What overshadows everything else is the castle.
sentences.chinese: 城堡使其他一切都相形见绌。

sentences.english: She seems extinguished by her younger sister in computery.
sentences.chinese: 在计算机的操作方面她妹妹似乎使她相形见绌。

sentences.english: Your beautiful garden put my few little flowers to shame.
sentences.chinese: 你那漂亮的花园使我那几朵小花相形见绌。

sentences.english: The fast maturing of girls leads to them outshining boys in exams.
sentences.chinese: 女孩的迅速成熟导致男孩在考试中相形见绌。

sentences.english: The publication of this new handbook have throw the old one into the shade.
sentences.chinese: 这本新手册的出版使旧作相形见绌。

sentences.english: He had him replaced with a powerful ally, Mark Malloch Brown, whose overpowering presence often seemed to diminish Annan.
sentences.chinese: 布朗的强势作为常使安南相形见绌。

sentences.english: Just the Ming Dynasty Wall dwarfs10 the Three Gorges dam project, " Lindesay says."
sentences.chinese: 光是明代长城就使三峡大坝工程相形见绌。

sentences.english: She outshines all of other competitors.
sentences.chinese: 她使所有的竞争者都相形见绌。

sentences.english: But this only makes matters worse for the country's pouting men.
sentences.chinese: 两相对照，那些撅嘴板脸的男队员更是相形见绌。

sentences.english: A giant's laughter could put to shame a dragon's roar.
sentences.chinese: 巨人的大笑声能让龙的咆哮都相形见绌。

sentences.english: It goes without saying that Shakespeare overshadows all the other playwrights throughout the ages.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问，莎士比亚使各个时代的剧作家相形见绌。

definition: to lose one's splendor/to lose luster/to be eclipsed/to be overshadowed
not inferior in any respect
lit. to have no time for civilities (idiom)/fig. not to be outdone/not to yield to one's opponents
lit. to see only the other rider's dust and have no hope of catching up (idiom)/to be far inferior
inferior (often in the combination 毫無遜色|毫无逊色, not in the least inferior)
not in the least inferior (idiom)
rude/impertinent
to step down gracefully (humble expression)/to concede defeat/to play second fiddle
lit. unable to distinguish eldest brother from second brother (idiom); they are all equally excellent/nothing to choose between them
(idiom) just passable/barely satisfactory
equally matched/about the same
to compare
lit. minor magician in the presence of a great one (idiom)/fig. to pale into insignificance by comparison
slightly better/a cut above
by contrast/but as for this.../viewed from another angle/subjectively/introspection
a crane in a flock of chicken (idiom); way above the common/manifestly superior
